content: nonna dishcloth knitting pattern by the creative critter difficulty level beginner gauge materials 1 ball of lily sugar n cream or 20 sts and 26 row in pattern = 4 inches any similar 100% cotton category 4 yarn gauge in this pattern is flexible feel us size 7 4 5mm knitting free to make these as big or as small as needles you wish by sizing up or down on your needles the-creative-critter com instagram @creativecritter want to learn how to knit but don t know where to start this is a great pattern for beginners and experts alike i learned how to knit while making dishcloths and wanted to create a more unique variation on this pattern that a family friend taught me thanks lindy the beauty of this pattern is in its simplicity and versatility you can make these bigger or smaller by sizing up or down on your needles and they look fantastic in all sizes make a few for your kitchen or make some for friends they make a fabulous handmade gift terminology co = cast on k= knit p= purl yo= yarn over k2tog= knit two together sts= stitches pattern main body/ increases co 4 sts in your preferred method row 1 knit all stitches 4 sts row 1 k2 yo k2 5 sts row 3 k2 yo k across 6 sts row 4 k2 yo *k1 p1 to last two sts k2 7 sts row 5 k2 yo *k1 p1 to last two sts k2 8 sts row 6 k2 yo knit across 9 sts row 7 k2 yo knit across 10 sts repeat row 4-7 10 more times until you have 50 sts you will end on row 7 the-creative-critter com instagram @creativecritter 2 decreases row 1 k1 k2tog yo k2tog *p1 k1 to last 2 sts k2 49 sts row 2 k1 k2tog yo k2tog *p1 k1 to last 2 sts k2 48 sts row 3 k1 k2tog yo k2tog k across 47 sts row 4 k1 k2tog yo k2tog k across 46 sts repeat row 1-4 until you have 6 sts remaining row 5 k1 k2tog yo k2tog *p1 k1 to last 2 sts k2 5 sts row 6 k1 k2tog yo k2tog *p1 k1 to last 2 sts k2 4 sts row 7 k across 4 sts bind off finishing weave in your ends and do a happy dance you have finished your nonna dishcloth notes/ care instructions these dishcloths will last and last and are tough enough to handle spills messes and cleaning your surfaces when your dishcloth is dirty just toss is in the washing machine and wash on warm if you have any questions or run into any issues with the pattern please email me at creativelycritter@gmail com or send me an instagram dm don t forget to use the hashtag #nonnadishcloth and tag me on instagram so that i can see your finished cloths i can t wait to see you rock your new dishcloths xo
